page.title: 01New Holland and District
page.content: It is a flat area on the South bank of the River Humber. The major habitation is the village of New Holland, which consists mainly of small houses built at the beginning of the 20th Century. The church of England/Methodist School is the newest main building in the village. Teh rest of the square is the area of farmland to the East. Along the river bank are several disused brick and tile works and their abandoned clay pits. One of these is used for water skiing. The main employers are a woodyard and a bulk materials port. There is also a small shipyard. The railway station is a new half opened 1981. the main agriculture crops of the area are cereal, rape, beet and hay.
